title: Igho Otegheri
text:
Igho Otegheri (born November 20, 1983 in <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a>) is a Nigerian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a>. He played for <a href="Heartland%20F.C.">Heartland F.C.</a>.
Career.
Otegheri began his career with <a href="Wikki%20Tourists">Wikki Tourists</a> in 2004 before transferring to <a href="Enugu%20Rangers">Enugu Rangers</a> for two years. He then signed with <a href="Dolphins%20F.C.%20%28Port%20Harcourt%29">Dolphins F.C.</a> in 2007.
Otegheri later joined <a href="Heartland%20F.C.">Heartland F.C.</a>, where he played until 22 January 2009 when he moved to <a href="Beitar%20Jerusalem%20F.C.">Beitar Jerusalem F.C.</a> with compatriot <a href="Anderson%20West">Anderson West</a>. He was released from his contract at 1 February 2009 and turned back to <a href="Heartland%20F.C.">Heartland F.C.</a>.
International.
Otegheri was a member of the <a href="Nigeria%20national%20football%20team">Super Eagles</a>, his debut coming on 2 February 2003 in a match against <a href="Costa%20Rica%20national%20football%20team">Costa Rica</a>
Personal life.
He married Nigerian track and field athlete <a href="Blessing%20Okagbare">Blessing Okagbare</a> in September 2014.
